intro: Solanum aculeastrum subsp. aculeastrum, commonly known as the spiny nightshade, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its branched stems covered in stiff, spiny hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by egg-shaped berries containing toxic seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry forests.
